ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Does Heretrix Follow a redirect link immediately
ygData.msgSnippet: OK, so there are hundreds of thousands of URIs on the same hostname still pending, and thus the targets of the redirects could still be waiting. It d take a

OK, so there are hundreds of thousands of URIs on the same hostname 
still pending, and thus the targets of the redirects could still be 
waiting. It'd take a closer analysis of where those redirects were 
targetted to know if either of my two theories are actually what's 
happening.

- Gordon @ IA

Anita Bidari wrote:
> 
> Here is the output of the frontier report for the domain.
> Queue movies.aol.com
>   263207 items
>    total expended: 94463 (total budget: -1)
>    active balance: 2763
>    last(avg) cost: 1(1.0
> 
> 
> Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:                                  nt_bdr wrote:
>  > I have set up Heretrix to crawl roughly around 100 domains. One of the
>  > domains in the seed has a huge number of redirect links (301's). 
>  > Upon looking at my crawl output I am seeing that there are 1,244
>  > "successful" pages out of 77,936 pages crawled for this domain.All the
>  > rest seem to be 301 redirects. In this case I would have expected to
>  > see a similar (approx 77,000) number of 200 responses that would have
>  > been crawled.
>  > Any ideas on why the "successful" page count is so low in this case?
>  
>  Some theories:
>  
>  - They might all be redirects to a small number of target pages (like a 
>  login page)
>  - They might be redirects to out-of-scope URLs (which are ignored).
>  
>  Are a large number of URLs pending in the queue for the target domain?
>  
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
>  
>      
>                        
>
